a flat bread roll baked with small pieces of onion in a hollow on the top: Unlike a bagel, which is boiled before baking, a bialy is simply baked, and instead of a hole in the middle, it has a depression. Come early: you will love the smell of our fresh baked bialys, a treasured recipe handed down from our Polish-Jewish heritage.
